channel.title: Searching for developers
channel.description:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/vzFWHA7.png[/img][/center]
I am searching for at least two content developers for my current rsps project. Its a PI based server based on OSRS. You do not have to be an expert programmer but you must be comprehensive at least.
[u]Requirements[/u]
[ul][li]Able to meet deadlines.[/li] [li]Comprehensive in the area applied for.[/li] [li]Take input and constructive critism.[/li] [li][/li][/ul]
[code]Name: Age: Position You're Applying For: Skype: Skill Level: Previous Work: Other:[/code]

item.title: Searching for developers
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Why would Runescape need a physics engine? For real though, there aren’t any game mechanics that COULD require it. Tweedle dee, tweedle dumb, and tweedle dumb ass starting stupid shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Searching for developers
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:10, topic:551204”][quote author=Welliton_inc link=topic=670119.msg4481258#msg4481258 date=1430043057]
What difference does it make? Java is Java
[/quote]
Just because it’s written in Java doesn’t mean 1 is going to be harder then the other. I’d like to see you implement content that I’m looking for client sided. How about you write a physics engine for me? Oh I also have 1000 classes of obfuscated code, don’t worry though “java is java”.[/quote]

u know ur like the shit stain on the underwear of moparscape that won’t go away. i leave for like 4 months and come back to this? wtf

Read full topic

item.title: Searching for developers
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:17, topic:551204”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=670119.msg4481314#msg4481314 date=1430077795]

why would you need a physics engine…?

Maybe I don’t like what’s currently available or want a learning curve, maybe I’m just crazy! It’s good to have your own though.

no why would an rs2 client need a physics engine…
[/quote]
There are many ways to make the game better. Why can’t you use physics?[/quote]

until you tell me a valid reason for a physics engine in the rs2 client, i will continue to think that you are a retard

Read full topic

item.title: Searching for developers
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Welliton_inc:

All I meant by it was that it shouldn’t be difficult to implement your knowledge into the client rather than through the server. But no… obviously you are correct?

He is correct. The servers were written with an alright naming, whereas the client is filled with methods without proper names(unless they’re renamed), making it hard to figure out exactly what does what, as opposed to servers which the methods and variables generally give a good idea of what they do based on what they’re named. Apart from that, the client is mostly dealing with models, which is a bit harder to work with afaik

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:

Position You’re Applying For: Server Developer(Not going to be involved with client unless you need major help)

What difference does it make? Java is Java
[/quote] you’re an idiot[/quote]
All I meant by it was that it shouldn’t be difficult to implement your knowledge into the client rather than through the server. But no… obviously you are correct?
